revised_title: The Role of Calcium in Yeast Flocculence in the Presence of Copper
tldr: The study investigates the role of calcium in the increased flocculence of yeast when grown in the presence of copper. It shows that calcium is necessary for yeast flocculation and that the more flocculent variants can replace the less flocculent ones when grown in a copper medium containing calcium. The research also demonstrates that calcium protects yeast cells from copper and that the less flocculent cells develop more resistance to copper during growth in a calcium-free medium.
